definition: protective umbrella/fig. person affording protection (esp. corrupt)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: It would give terrorists a nuclear umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 它会给恐怖分子一把核保护伞。

sentences.english: Abolishment of "nuclear umbrella " and "nuclear sharing" policies and practices.
sentences.chinese: 应废除“核保护伞”和“核共享”的政策与实践。

sentences.english: Then, belatedly, an umbrella of governance would be added.
sentences.chinese: 然后，才慢腾腾的添加治理这把保护伞。

sentences.english: In fact, many states rely on “nuclear umbrellas” provided by their allied nuclear-armed states.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，许多国家依靠其有核盟国提供“核保护伞”。

sentences.english: Since then, the well-being of Wilbur also have their own umbrella and a good friend.
sentences.chinese: 幸福的威尔伯也从此有了自己的保护伞和好朋友。

sentences.english: Put on a coat of nail strengthener to the tips of your nail to act as a protective shield.
sentences.chinese: 穿上大衣的指甲增强剂的提示您的指甲充当保护伞。

sentences.english: Is obscene material covered by the First Amendment's umbrella?
sentences.chinese: 淫秽材料是否也在《第一条修正案》的保护伞之下？

definition: variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
asylum/shelter/to shield/to put under protection/to take under one's wing
insect that eats into wood, books, clothes etc/fig. vermin
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand/(Tw) mechanic/blue-collar worker/manual laborer
